summary: This bill, the 'Stopping Overdoses of Fentanyl Analogues Act' (S. 165), aims to amend the Controlled Substances Act by adding fentanyl-related substances to Schedule I controlled substances. It defines "fentanyl-related substances" based on specific structural modifications. The bill's stated goal is to combat the opioid crisis by controlling substances with chemical similarities to fentanyl. The Act would take effect one day after enactment.
